review: I hopped on the Chromecast bandwagon as soon as I could. I mean the marketing was perfect, for 35$ you can stream everything from your android device to whatever is open in Google chrome on your computer. Sounds perfect till you actually start looking for apps that Google is allowing to use it. When i first got it Netflix and Google's Play Apps and Youtube were the only thing that were available that I found myself to use. Now we have AVIA, HBO, and a couple other apps. Avia is what is needed to stream photos, music and videos from your phone. Google Play Music ******WILL NOT****** play music sideloaded from your phone on the Chromecast, that means no music you physically put on the device will be playable through Google Play Music on Chromecast!! (This is where AVIA comes in handy) Only music uploaded to Play Music "Cloud" will work with Chromecast. This didn't really affect me because about 90% of my music is stored on the "Cloud", but I did find it annoying when I did have a track that I downloaded from my phone that I wanted to listen too. I'm still waiting for more apps though, as of this review there aren't any games that you can stream, and still not a whole lot of apps in general. Overall, for 35$ I'm not disappointed. I got a little less than what i wanted but it still awesome! I still find myself using it nearly everyday, the user interfaces are a lot easier to navigate through compared to the PS3.
